an infinite board an infinite grid with only one player and it has four rules
the rules of life the first rule of Conway's Game of Life all of the cells on this grid can be living or dead if a
cell has zero or one living neighbors it dies of loneliness if a cell has exactly
two neighbors it survives for another generation if a cell has four or more
neighbors it dies of overcrowding and finally the slightly spooky bit if a
cell has exactly three living neighbors it comes back to life in the next
generation of the game that's it that is the complete those four rules describe everything you need to know
about Conway's Game of Life now in 1970 when this was first published people
used pencils and diagrams and graph paper to try and understand the behavior of these systems and they drew diagrams
